Performance-Driven. Authentic. At Callaway® Apparel, we celebrate golf’s rich heritage by creating products that honor its past while defining its future. Callaway® Apparel is the ultimate combination of golf authenticity, classic styling and technically advanced construction because apparel that offers quality, performance, and functionality is as important to golfers as the equipment they use. Now Golf Memberships Home / Stay / Golf / Golf Memberships Golf at Callaway Become A Member Connection Golf Membership The Connection Golf membership grants access to Callaway Resort & Gardens for the Individual Member or for the Family Membership, two (2) adults and any dependents up to 24 years of age. Individual $184 Per Month Family $260 Per Month *All dues and fees are subject to applicable sales tax and are subject to change. Must reside inside Callaway Resort & Gardens to obtain this membership. View Benefits × - Full Golf privileges, including one round of golf per day on a space-available basis with 14-day advance tee times. Cart fee not included. - Golf tournaments, organized golf leagues, and full Twin Oaks practice facility access. Range Balls included. - Member Guest rates for both accompanied and unaccompanied guests. - Automatic Payments are available for dues and member events. All Golf fees must be paid at the clubhouse. - Unlimited General Admission to the beautiful Gardens including the Callaway Discovery Center, Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center, Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl, Ida Cason Callaway Memorial Chapel, Birds of Prey show, Robin Lake Beach, Discovery Bicycle Trails, Overlook Azalea Garden, many walking trails. - Admission to our Master’s Water Ski & Wakeboard Tournament on Memorial Day Weekend, the July 4th Extravaganza, and the Hot Air Balloon Festival over Labor Day Weekend. - Member-only events and programs - 30% Discount on Educational Workshops and select Callaway Gardens programs - 50% Discount on any night of Fantasy in Lights (both levels). Prunifolia also receives six (6) free tickets - 30% Discount on Bicycle Rentals, Fishing, Golf, Kayak Rentals, Tennis, and TreeTop Adventure - 10% Discount in our Gift Shops - 10% Discount in our Restaurants (Food Only) - 15% Discount in Mountain View Golf Shop Annual Golf Membership Annual Golf Membership grants access to Callaway Resort & Gardens for Individual Member or for Family Membership, two (2) adults and any dependents under 24 years of age. Individual $289 Per Month Family $420 Per Month *All dues and fees are subject to applicable sales tax and are subject to change. Military & First Responder Golf Membership Annual Golf Membership grants access to Callaway Resort & Gardens for Individual Member or for Family Membership, two (2) adults and any dependents under 24 years of age. Individual $250 Per Month Family $350 Per Month *All dues and fees are subject to applicable sales tax and are subject to change. Golf Members Enjoy: Full Golf privileges, including one round of golf per day on a space available basis with 14 day advance tee times. Cart fee not included. Unlimited practice balls for members and guests. 10% Discount in Champions Grille (Food Only). 15% Discount on Merchandise in the Mountain View Golf Shop Golf tournaments, organized golf leagues and full access to the Twin Oaks practice facility. Eight (8) One-time use guest passes. Once passes are gone, guest pays the normal greens fee. Member Guest rates for both accompanied and unaccompanied guests. Member-only events and programs Automatic Payments are available for dues and member events. All Golf fees must be paid at the clubhouse. Topgolf Callaway Brands - National Golf Foundation Welcome, Account Logout Join NGF Login Short Game Full Shots The Clubhouse Golf Industry Facts Course Facts Golfer Facts Member Reports Publications The Graffis Report Graffis Report Summary Golf Directories Services Research Marketing Consulting GolfersVoice Membership Membership Options Sample Content Top 100 Welcome2Golf About FAQs History Board of Directors Our People Our Members Our Awards Careers NGF in the News The President’s Page Sneak Peek FAQs Back Topgolf Callaway Brands Corporate Headquarters: Carlsbad, California Website: https://www.topgolfcallawaybrands.com/ Additional Websites: https://www.callawaygolf.com/ , https://topgolf.com/us/ , https://www.travismathew.com/ , https://odyssey.callawaygolf.com/ , https://www.ogio.com/ Affiliated Companies: Topgolf, Callaway Golf, TravisMathew, Odyssey, Ogio Company Overview Topgolf Callaway Brands Corp. is a tech-enabled Modern Golf and active lifestyle company with a portfolio of global brands including Topgolf, Callaway Golf, TravisMathew, Toptracer, Odyssey, OGIO, Jack Wolfskin, and World Golf Tour (WGT). The company represents the convergence of traditional golf equipment manufacturing with modern golf entertainment and technology. Following a strategic review, the company announced plans to separate into two independent entities through a spinoff of at least 80.1% of the Topgolf business to shareholders. The separation, projected for the second half of 2025, aims to better position both companies for success due to their different operating models, capital structures, and investment propositions. Post-separation, Callaway will retain the existing financial debt and consist of the golf equipment and active lifestyle businesses, plus Toptracer. Topgolf will operate debt-free with a significant cash balance, focusing on its entertainment venues and technology platforms. Strategic Vision As articulated by CEO Chip Brewer: “Our long-term strategic path forward emphasizes our unique and dominant leadership in the Modern Golf space. While anchored in our strong heritage business, we continue to build important awareness for our strategic shift towards exciting new ventures in the Modern Golf and active lifestyle segments.” Topgolf Callaway Key Facts: Operates over 100 Topgolf venues globally Generated approximately $2.5 billion in revenue from golf equipment business Topgolf entertainment venues generated roughly $1.8 billion in revenue Leading manufacturer of golf equipment and accessories Pioneering golf entertainment through technology-enabled venues Employs thousands across its various brands and venues Business Model Innovation The company operates through multiple revenue streams: Traditional Golf Equipment: Premium clubs, balls, and accessories under Callaway and Odyssey brands Golf Entertainment: Tech-enabled Topgolf venues combining gaming, food & beverage, and social experiences Lifestyle Brands: Active wear and accessories through TravisMathew, Jack Wolfskin, and OGIO Technology Solutions: Toptracer ball-tracking technology and WGT digital gaming platform Growth and Development The company has transformed from a traditional golf equipment manufacturer to a comprehensive golf and lifestyle brand through strategic acquisitions and innovations: Merger with Topgolf in 2021 Expansion of Topgolf venues globally Integration of Toptracer technology Development of digital gaming platforms Growth of lifestyle apparel brands Commitment to Modern Golf Topgolf Callaway Brands is focused on making golf more accessible and enjoyable through multiple channels: Traditional Golf: Premium equipment for serious players Entertainment: Casual introduction to golf through Topgolf venues Digital Engagement: Virtual gaming and online experiences Technology Integration: Advanced tracking and training tools Lifestyle Products: Golf-inspired apparel and accessories Future Plans The company continues to invest in innovation while maintaining its position in traditional golf markets. Focus areas include: Global expansion of Topgolf venues Enhancement of technology platforms Development of new equipment technologies Growth of lifestyle brand portfolio Digital gaming and virtual experiences KEY FACTS FOR OTHER COMPANIES WITHIN THE PORTFOLIO Callaway Golf: One of the world’s largest golf equipment manufacturers Known for innovative technologies like AI-designed club faces Market leader in golf clubs, particularly drivers and irons Significant presence in golf ball market Products used by top professional golfers worldwide TravisMathew: Premium lifestyle and performance apparel brand Rapidly growing presence in golf and active lifestyle segments Popular among both professional athletes and casual consumers Expanded from golf wear into lifestyle and fitness apparel Strong retail presence with standalone stores nationwide Odyssey: #1 putter brand in golf Used by professional golfers across all major tours Known for innovative insert technologies Market leader in premium putter segment Consistently top-performing brand in golf specialty retail Toptracer: Ball-tracking and gaming technology used in Topgolf venues Installed at over 700 driving ranges worldwide Powers broadcast graphics for professional golf tournaments Enables virtual golf experiences and games Growing adoption in traditional driving ranges and practice facilities KEY TAKEAWAYS Despite the pending separation, Topgolf Callaway Brands represents the evolution of golf from a traditional sport to a modern, tech-enabled lifestyle activity. Through its diverse portfolio of brands and services, the company is uniquely positioned to serve both traditional golfers and new audiences discovering the game through entertainment venues and digital platforms. The company’s mission is to be the global leader in modern golf, helping the game’s continued evolution by making it more accessible and enjoyable for everyone. Share The following are the businesses included in the latest version of the NGF GOLF 100, an effort to highlight the vitality, size and diversity of a $102 billion-a-year industry. This is an alphabetical list, not a ranking, of companies and brands that deliver products and services primarily targeted to commercial golf and conduct all or a majority of their business within the U.S. Find an issue with a company profile? Whether it’s information, staffing or logo that needs to be updated, please contact our editorial director, Erik Matuszewski, at erikm@ngf.org . Now Cast a Line in Some of the Best Lakes in the Southeast … or Just Enjoy the View by Boat Home / Beach / Activities / Fishing Boating Fishing & Boating Some of the best fishing in the Southeastern United States is found right here, amidst the incomparable beauty of Callaway Resort & Gardens. Our thirteen sparkling lakes are renowned for enormous bream, crappie, shellcrackers, and trophy sized bass. And because our lakes are private, no fishing license is needed. If fishing is not your sport, enjoy some relaxing time on the water and spectacular views with a kayak or boat excursion. Things To Know Gardens Hours of Operation Boathouse Wednesday to Sunday - 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Daily Monday & Tuesday - Closed Callaway Outdoors Pro Shop: Wednesday to Sunday - 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Daily Monday & Tuesday - Closed Callaway Outdoors & Boathouse operates daily year round (hours flex seasonally). This location offers jon boat rentals, canoes, kayaks, shore fishing, and private guided fishing excursions. Our lakes have some of the best fishing in the Southeast and carry trophy size bass. All fish are catch and release. Fishing is only allowed in Mountain Creek Lake, unless booked on a guided trip. Please Note: For the maintenance and health of our lakes, for the foreseeable future, Bass will be catch and release only as we work to develop a trophy fishing program at Callaway. Shore Fishing at Mountain Creek Lake Callaway Gardens fishing from the shore is allowed at the Boat House on Mountain Creek Lake, located beside the Callaway Outdoors shop. With stocked live worms/crickets ($5 per container) and fishing poles available for rent ( $15 per rod & tackle) it’s as easy as just showing up for a fun day at Callaway. Shore fishing must be registered at the Pro Shop, $10 per hour, and children 5 and under are $5 each !  All children must be accompanied by an adult for the duration of their fishing experience. Come teach a child to fish and enjoy a lifetime of memories. Reminder: Bass are catch and release. Get Outside with Callaway Outdoors Callaway Outdoors is pleased to offer jon boat, canoe, kayak, rod and tackle rentals, and the on-site pro shop offers gear and snacks, so all you need to do is arrive and enjoy some time outside in nature. Learn More Rates & Rentals Boat and equipment rentals are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. Guided excursions and private instruction require a minimum of seven days notice. For reservations and more information, call (855) 583-3758 or email rcrenshaw@callawaygardens.com . Jon Boat Rentals with Trolling Motors Half Day (4 Hours): $35* for 1 person, $50* for 2, $65* for 3 Full Day (8 Hours): $55* for 1 person, $70* for 2, $85* for 3 Canoe Rental: $20* for first hour, $25* for 2, $30* for 3 | Life Jacket Required $5* per person Tandem Kayak Rental: $30* for first hour, $35* for 2, $40* for 3 | Life Jacket Required $5 per person Shore Fishing at Mountain Creek Lake: Age 6+) $10* per hour; children 5 and under are $5* Rod & Tackle Rentals: $15* per 1 person Private Fly-Fishing Instruction: $60* for 1-hour casting lesson, $30* when part of a guided excursion Guided Fly-Fishing or Bass Excursion: Avid anglers and novices alike will relish the chance to take a guided trip on one of our 12 lakes that are otherwise off limits for fishing. Certified instructors lead the way on half- or full-day guided trips for largemouth bass and bream dependent on the season. Our Team at Callaway Outdoors provides all the necessary equipment, and fly-fishing trips are done primarily on float tubes on our professionally managed lakes. Please note that to maintain the integrity of our beautiful landscape, our guided trips are catch and release only. Float tubes and fly-fishing equipment are only for instruction and guided trips, and are not available for rental. Private instruction is also available. All of our courses are taught by professional casting instructors with years of experience and an infectious passion for their pursuits. Half-Day (4 Hours): $250* for 1-2 people, $100 for each additional person Full-Day (8 Hours): $375* for full day for 1-2 people, $150 for each additional person. Now Cast a Line in Some of the Best Lakes in the Southeast … or Just Enjoy the View by Boat Home / Beach / Activities / Fishing Boating Fishing & Boating Some of the best fishing in the Southeastern United States is found right here, amidst the incomparable beauty of Callaway Resort & Gardens. Our thirteen sparkling lakes are renowned for enormous bream, crappie, shellcrackers, and trophy sized bass. And because our lakes are private, no fishing license is needed. If fishing is not your sport, enjoy some relaxing time on the water and spectacular views with a kayak or boat excursion. Things To Know Gardens Hours of Operation Boathouse Wednesday to Sunday - 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Daily Monday & Tuesday - Closed Callaway Outdoors Pro Shop: Wednesday to Sunday - 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Daily Monday & Tuesday - Closed Callaway Outdoors & Boathouse operates daily year round (hours flex seasonally). This location offers jon boat rentals, canoes, kayaks, shore fishing, and private guided fishing excursions. Our lakes have some of the best fishing in the Southeast and carry trophy size bass. All fish are catch and release. Fishing is only allowed in Mountain Creek Lake, unless booked on a guided trip. Please Note: For the maintenance and health of our lakes, for the foreseeable future, Bass will be catch and release only as we work to develop a trophy fishing program at Callaway. Shore Fishing at Mountain Creek Lake Callaway Gardens fishing from the shore is allowed at the Boat House on Mountain Creek Lake, located beside the Callaway Outdoors shop. With stocked live worms/crickets ($5 per container) and fishing poles available for rent ( $15 per rod & tackle) it’s as easy as just showing up for a fun day at Callaway. Shore fishing must be registered at the Pro Shop, $10 per hour, and children 5 and under are $5 each !  All children must be accompanied by an adult for the duration of their fishing experience. Come teach a child to fish and enjoy a lifetime of memories. Reminder: Bass are catch and release. Get Outside with Callaway Outdoors Callaway Outdoors is pleased to offer jon boat, canoe, kayak, rod and tackle rentals, and the on-site pro shop offers gear and snacks, so all you need to do is arrive and enjoy some time outside in nature. Learn More Rates & Rentals Boat and equipment rentals are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. Guided excursions and private instruction require a minimum of seven days notice. For reservations and more information, call (855) 583-3758 or email rcrenshaw@callawaygardens.com . Jon Boat Rentals with Trolling Motors Half Day (4 Hours): $35* for 1 person, $50* for 2, $65* for 3 Full Day (8 Hours): $55* for 1 person, $70* for 2, $85* for 3 Canoe Rental: $20* for first hour, $25* for 2, $30* for 3 | Life Jacket Required $5* per person Tandem Kayak Rental: $30* for first hour, $35* for 2, $40* for 3 | Life Jacket Required $5 per person Shore Fishing at Mountain Creek Lake: Age 6+) $10* per hour; children 5 and under are $5* Rod & Tackle Rentals: $15* per 1 person Private Fly-Fishing Instruction: $60* for 1-hour casting lesson, $30* when part of a guided excursion Guided Fly-Fishing or Bass Excursion: Avid anglers and novices alike will relish the chance to take a guided trip on one of our 12 lakes that are otherwise off limits for fishing. Certified instructors lead the way on half- or full-day guided trips for largemouth bass and bream dependent on the season. Our Team at Callaway Outdoors provides all the necessary equipment, and fly-fishing trips are done primarily on float tubes on our professionally managed lakes. Please note that to maintain the integrity of our beautiful landscape, our guided trips are catch and release only. Float tubes and fly-fishing equipment are only for instruction and guided trips, and are not available for rental. Private instruction is also available. All of our courses are taught by professional casting instructors with years of experience and an infectious passion for their pursuits. Half-Day (4 Hours): $250* for 1-2 people, $100 for each additional person Full-Day (8 Hours): $375* for full day for 1-2 people, $150 for each additional person. Price includes lunch. *Does not include tax Fishing Limits For the maintenance and health of our lakes, for the foreseeable future, Bass and Carp will be catch and release only as we work to develop a trophy fishing program at Callaway. Bream limit is fifteen (15) per boat. Crappie limit is thirty (30) per boat. VIEW FISHING GUIDELINES Please Note: Shore (bank) fishing is only allowed at Mountain Creek Lake under supervision of Callaway Outdoors Pro Shop.  No other bank fishing is allowed at Callaway Resort & Gardens to protect the nature of the Gardens and health of the lakes. Private boats, float tubes, and the use of bait fish is strictly prohibited. Get The Latest News and Special Offers Subscribe to our newsletter, special offers and promotional emails. Callaway Resort & Gardens offers four seasons of adventure, relaxation, and fun in Mother Nature’s breathtaking landscape. Take in the vibrant blossoms of Spring on over 2,500 spectacular acres, filled with hiking and bike trails and world-class golf. Georgia Golf Resort Golf at Callaway Resort & Gardens Whether you prefer a more challenging course or a fun, scenic course with lots of water hazards, you’ll find it at our Georgia golf resort, just an hour’s drive from Atlanta. Try a round on our challenging Mountain View Course or on the beautiful Lake View Course , which offers wider fairways and lots of water features. Both golf courses are revered by those who’ve played them. Before you choose one, go ahead and brush up on your skills at our world-class Twin Oaks Practice Facility. To book a lesson or for more information regarding golf, contact our Director of Golf, Charles Dannewitz, at cdannewitz@callawaygardens.com Book a Tee Time Make your booking online now or call the Pro Shop directly at: 706-663-6799 Book Now View Rates & Policies Two 18-Hole Championship Courses Lake View Course The picturesque Lake View, Callaway Resort & Gardens’ original golf course, features wider fairways and more water holes, reflecting the philosophy of the Gardens' founder Cason Callaway, who was fond of saying that if a golfer lifts his or her head on a shot, they should see something beautiful. Explore the Course Mountain View Course The challenging, but playable layout of the Mountain View Course will test your strategic and shotmaking abilities, just as it did for PGA Tour pros when it hosted the Buick Challenge from 1991 to 2002. The list of winners is a who’s-who of Tour stars, with champions including Davis Love III, David Duval and more. Explore the Course Golf Stay & Play Packages From family vacations to golf weekends—whatever brings you to Callaway Resort & Gardens, you’ll want to stay at our lakeside Lodge, spacious Cottages or secluded Villas while you play on one of the championship courses. View Packages Golf Memberships Become a golf member to enjoy one round of golf per day based on availability, unlimited practice balls, discounts on food at Champions Grille, discounts on merchandise at the Mountain View Golf Shop, guest passes, and so much more.* *Select restrictions apply. Become a Member Callaway Cruiser Carts Our cruiser carts are the fun, stylish way to navigate Callaway Resort & Gardens with ease. Choose from 4-Passenger and 6-Passenger carts. Reserve a Cruiser History Set in the scenic foothills of the Appalachian Mountains, the golf courses of Callaway Resort & Gardens have a rich history stretching back to 1949 when architect J.B. McGovern, with considerable input from Cason Callaway, designed the first nine holes of the Lake View Course.
